column1: “A person who approaches the Court to grant of discretionary relief,
to  which  category  an  application  for  certiorari  would  undoubtedly
belong, has to come with clean hands, and should candidly disclose
all the material facts which have any hearing on the adjudication of
the issues raised.  He owes a duty of utmost good faith (uberrima
fides)  to  the  Court  to  make  a  full  and  complete  disclosure  of  all
material  fact  within  his  knowledge  of  which  he  could  have  known
by exercising diligence expected of a person of ordinary prudence”.
